text.div:
This case-insensitive code system http://worldhealthorganization.github.io/smart-hiv/CodeSystem/HIV.H defines the following codes:

CodeDisplayDefinition
DE1 Reason for follow-upThe reason why the client is being followed up
DE2 Missed care visitClient did not present for a care appointment as scheduled / as expected
DE3 Missed medication pickupClient did not pick up medication as scheduled from pharmacy or other drug distribution point
DE4 Did not initiate ARTClient did not initiate ART at the same time as diagnosis (e.g., because they required additional counselling) and required follow-up for ART initiation
DE5 Incomplete visitClient presented for care, but left before services were completed, e.g., due to long wait times or not staying to have labs taken
DE6 Inconclusive HIV statusClient has not returned for a follow-up test after an inconclusive test result
DE7 Test results receivedClient needs to be informed of test results (e.g., viral load)
DE8 Other follow-up reasonClient was followed up for another reason
DE9 Other follow-up reason (specify)Client was followed up for another reason (specify)
DE10 Client contact attemptedAn attempt to locate the client was made
DE11 Date of contact attemptDate of attempt to contact client
DE12 Contact attempted byWho attempted to reach out to the client
DE13 Contact methodMethod used to try to reach out to the client
DE14 Home visitContacted client at home
DE15 Text messageContacted client by short message service (SMS) text
DE16 PhoneContacted client by phone call
DE17 Source of informationSource of information about the client
DE18 ClientThe client was the source of information
DE19 Informed by treatment providerSource of information was a treatment provider of the client
DE20 Informed by family or partnerSource of information was a family member of partner
DE21 Other source of informationInformation about the client's status was provided by someone else
DE22 Other source of information (specify)Information about the client's status was provided by someone else (specify)
DE23 Outcome from outreach attemptDetailed outcome from the attempt to locate the client
DE24 Returning to clinicClient was located and agreed to return to clinic
DE25 Self-transferred outClient transferred to another facility for care (client-initiated transfer, not provider-initiated transfer)
DE26 HospitalizedClient was hospitalized
DE27 Refused to returnClient was found but declined to return to treatment
DE28 Not located Attempt was made to locate client, but client was not found
DE29 Died (reported)The client was reported as having died
DE30 Moved from catchment areaThe client moved from the catchment area (may be reported from the community level)
DE31 Date client moved from catchment areaThe date on which the client moved from the catchment area, if known
DE32 New catchment areaNew catchment area where the client resides
DE33 Partner or contact of index caseThe client was identified by an index case as a partner or contact
DE34 HIV status of partner or contactHIV status of the partner or contact given by the index case
DE35 Already knew positiveThe partner or contact of the index case already knew they are HIV-positive
DE36 Newly diagnosedThe partner or contact of the index case is newly diagnosed as HIV-positive
DE37 NegativeThe partner or contact of the index case is newly diagnosed is HIV-negative
DE38 Date of death If deceased, the date that the client died
DE39 Cause of deathCause of death, if known
DE40 Place of deathWhere the client died, if known
DE41 HIV treatment outcomeThe outcome for the client which is used for reporting retention/attrition.
DE42 Lost to follow-upTwenty-eight days or more since last missed appointment
DE43 Transferred outThe client transferred to another facility
DE44 Death (documented)People living with HIV previously on ART who are confirmed to have died from any cause
DE45 Refused (stopped) treatmentClient was contacted and confirmed to have stopped ART (reasons may include stigma and discrimination, faith healing, etc.)
DE46 Date patient lost to follow-upDate patient was lost to follow-up (LTFU)
DE47 On ARTClient is currently taking ART
DE48 Date HIV treatment outcome changedThe date on which the client's outcome (lost to follow-up, transferred out, death (documented), or refused (stopped) treatment) changed
DE49 Transfer confirmedSelect if transfer to another facility is confirmed
DE50 Transfer to facilityName of health facility client was transferred to
DE51 Date of transfer outThe date the client transferred out of the facility to be provided with care at another facility
DE52 Adherence assessmentWhether client is adherent or not to ART regimen per national guidelines (immunological or virological monitoring)
DE53 Reason(s) for adherence problemReason why client is not adherent
DE54 ForgotClient reported not being adherent because they forgot
DE55 Toxicity/side effectsClient reported not being adherent because of toxicity/side effects
DE56 BusyClient reported not being adherent because they were busy
DE57 Change of routineClient reported not being adherent because of a change of routine
DE58 Travel costClient reported not being adherent because of travel cost
DE59 Distance to clinicClient reported not being adherent because of distance to clinic
DE60 Client lost/ran out of pillsClient reported not being adherent because of client lost/ran out of pills
DE61 Stock-outClient reported not being adherent because of a stock-out
DE62 Too illClient reported not being adherent because of being too ill
DE63 Pill burdenClient reported not being adherent because of the pill burden
DE64 Felt wellClient reported not being adherent because they felt well
DE65 DepressionClient reported not being adherent because of depression
DE66 Alcohol useClient reported not being adherent because of alcohol use
DE67 Substance useClient reported not being adherent because of substance use (i.e., drugs)
DE68 Stigma/disclosure concernsClient reported not being adherent because of stigma/disclosure concerns
DE69 Lack of foodClient reported not being adherent because of a lack of food
DE70 Poor palatabilityClient reported not being adherent because of poor palatability
DE71 OtherClient reported not being adherent because of other reason
DE72 Other (specify)Client reported not being adherent because of other reason (specify)
DE73 Date ART stoppedDate on which client stopped ART
DE74 Reason ART stoppedReason why client intentionally stopped ART
DE75 Toxicity/side effectsClient stopped ART because of toxicity/side effects
DE76 Severe illness, hospitalizationClient stopped ART because of severe illness, hospitalization
DE77 Drugs out of stock Client stopped ART because of drugs being out of stock
DE78 Client lacks finances Client stopped ART because client lacked finances
DE79 Excluded HIV infection in infantClient stopped ART because the infant was determined to not have HIV
DE80 Other reason for stopping ARTClient stopped ART for other reason
DE81 Other reason for stopping ART (specify)Client stopped ART for other reason (specify)

name: HIV_M
title: HIV.H Follow-up  CodeSystem
description: CodeSystem for HIV.H Follow-up  Data Elements

concept.definition: The reason why the client is being followed up

Client reported not being adherent because of poor palatability
Client reported not being adherent because of other reason
